meanings.definition: To cause fear or alarm in someone.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm was frighting the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was so frighting that I couldn't sleep.
meanings.sent3: The prankster enjoyed frighting his friends by jumping out from behind doors.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house was frighting, as if ghosts were lurking.
meanings.sent5: The sudden scream in the dark alley was frighting, making everyone freeze in fear.

meanings.definition: The act of scaring or alarming someone.
meanings.sent1: Her costume was a frighting sight at the Halloween party.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was full of frighting surprises around every corner.
meanings.sent3: The little boy's exaggerated ghost story was more amusing than frighting.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure in the fog looked like a frighting monster from a nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The sudden appearance of the spider was a frighting moment for the arachnophobe.
